title.value: Two families of indexable partially observable restless bandits and Whittle index computation
title.justification: The information indicates this as the title based on the structure and placement at the beginning of the document.
title.quote: Title: Two families of indexable partially observable restless bandits and Whittle index computation

extractions.description: The paper investigates restless bandits with general finite state space under partial observability with two observational models, proving their indexability and deriving methods for Whittle index computation.

type.justification: The paper focuses on theoretical frameworks and proofs for restless bandits models and Whittle index computation, without conducting empirical experiments or collecting data.
type.quote: Under the assumption that the models satisfy a restart property, we prove that both models are indexable.

name.justification: The paper deals with optimization, scheduling, and resource allocation problems, which are key aspects of Operations Research.
name.quote: Keywords: Multi-armed bandits; Restless bandits; Whittle index; indexability; partially observable; scheduling; resource allocation.

name.justification: The paper involves models and algorithms related to decision making and optimization within the realm of machine learning.
name.quote: The result indicates that the Whittle index policy outperforms myopic policy and can be close to optimal in different setups.
